abstract: A $1.4 billion fine against Intel, combined with a tough speech by the Justice Department’s antitrust chief, point to a new day for antitrust enforcement in high-tech markets.
snippet: A $1.4 billion fine against Intel, combined with a tough speech by the Justice Department’s antitrust chief, point to a new day for antitrust enforcement in high-tech markets.
lead_paragraph: The European Union’s $1.4 billion fine against Intel on Wednesday, combined with a “fair warning” speech this week by the Justice Department’s antitrust chief, point to a new day for antitrust enforcement in high-technology markets worldwide.

headline.main: High-Tech Antitrust Cases: The Road Ahead
